title: Rational Function Graph - Reasoning for Holes

content.question: The function <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="r open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared minus x minus 2 over denominator open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses squared open parentheses x minus 2 close parentheses end fraction"><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, which of the following is true about holes in the graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> ?

choices.label: There are holes at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> because the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the denominator is greater than the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the numerator, and because the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the denominator.

There are holes at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> because the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the denominator, and because the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the denominator.

There is a hole at <math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> only because the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the denominator is greater than the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the numerator, and because the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the denominator.

There is a hole at <math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> only because the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the denominator, and because the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the denominator.

content.answer: There is a hole at <math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> only because the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the denominator is greater than the multiplicity of <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the numerator, and because the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the numerator is equal to the multiplicity of <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> in the denominator.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
